SENT.plain: We describe a patient with incontinentia pigmenti who developed the clinical picture of intestinal Behçet's disease
Diagnosis of Behçet's disease was base on a recurrent genital and oral ulcer and a positive HLA-B51
Impaired neutrophil chemotactic activity and an elevated plasma IL-6 level were found
Chromosomal study revealed no abnormality in the patient or her family
We discuss the possibility that there are common immunological abnormalities in the two syndromes
